page.title: 05INTERESTING PEOPLE
page.content: {Interviews with Local People.} A visit to{Soughton Farm}gives us a unique picture of a farmer who has specialised in breeding animals only, when other farmers in the area have tried to supplement their income by "market gardening" although most farmers buy the produce from local markets. Mr. Baker, the farmer, has not done this and has achieved great success in keeping pedigree animals. The farm is 250 acres and holds Jerseys, Fresians,Herefords, Ayrshires and Charolais for breeding purposes. He gave Â£1200 for a Suffolk ewe. "You need common sense to be a farmer." He has 2 men and a part-timer working for him at about Â£150 a week. He also has 30 acres of corn and 220-230 animals. He used to show them but now he only judges. He won the Royal Welsh twice, and has a good reputation. cont...
